Question: What is the primary use of algorithms and data structures in computer science? (Theoretical) (Understanding Data Structures and Algorithms)
Option A: To build complex software systems
Option B: To understand the intricacies of computer hardware
Option C: To build efficient, optimized solutions to complex problems
Option D: To develop artificial intelligence
Correct Answer: C) To build efficient, optimized solutions to complex problems

Question: What is the time complexity of searching for an element in an unsorted array? (Understanding) (Time Complexity of Searching in an Unsorted Array)
Option A: O(log n)
Option B: O(n)
Option C: O(n log n)
Correct Answer: B) O(n)

Question: What is the advantage of arrays in terms of memory usage? (Remembering) (Characteristics of Arrays)
Option A: Arrays use more memory than other data structures
Option B: Arrays use contiguous memory, making them memory-efficient
Option C: Arrays are not suitable for large datasets
Option D: Arrays are only used for dynamic data
Correct Answer: B) Arrays use contiguous memory, making them memory-efficient

Question: What is the disadvantage of arrays in terms of size? (Logical Reasoning) (Disadvantages of Arrays)
Option A: Arrays can be too large
Option B: Arrays have a fixed size
Option C: Arrays are not suitable for small datasets
Option D: Arrays are only used for dynamic data
Correct Answer: B) Arrays have a fixed size

Question: What is the primary difference between singly linked lists and doubly linked lists? (Pseudocode) (Doubly Linked Lists vs. Singly Linked Lists)
Option A: The number of nodes in the list
Option B: The direction of traversal
Option C: The memory usage
Option D: The data type stored in the nodes
Correct Answer: B) The direction of traversal

Question: What is the advantage of doubly linked lists in terms of deletion? (Understanding) (Advantages of Doubly Linked Lists)
Option A: It takes longer to delete a node
Option B: It is more complex to delete a node
Option C: It is faster to delete a node
Option D: It is not possible to delete a node
Correct Answer: C) It is faster to delete a node

Question: What is the time complexity of summing elements in an array using the provided pseudocode? (Pseudocode) (Pseudocode for Summing Elements in an Array)
Option A: O(log n)
Option B: O(n)
Option C: O(n log n)
Correct Answer: B) O(n)

Question: What is the space complexity of summing elements in an array using the provided pseudocode? (Remembering) (Analysis)
Option A: O(n)
Option C: O(log n)
Option D: O(n log n)

Question: What is the primary property of a Binary Search Tree? (Theoretical) (Binary Search Trees)
Option A: Each node has at most three children
Option B: The value of the left child is greater than its parent node
Option C: The value of the left child is less than its parent node
Option D: The tree is always balanced
Correct Answer: C) The value of the left child is less than its parent node

Question: What is the time complexity of search operations in a balanced Binary Search Tree? (Understanding) (Time Complexity of Binary Search Trees)
Option A: O(n)
Option B: O(log n)
Option C: O(n log n)
Correct Answer: B) O(log n)

Question: What is the primary application of Max-Heaps? (Logical Reasoning) (Max-Heap Characteristics)
Option A: Database indexing
Option B: Priority queues
Option C: File system navigation
Option D: Browser history navigation
Correct Answer: B) Priority queues

Question: What is the time complexity of insertion and deletion operations in a Max-Heap? (Pseudocode) (Operations and Time Complexities)
Option A: O(n)
Option B: O(log n)
Option C: O(n log n)
Correct Answer: B) O(log n)

Question: What is the primary advantage of balanced trees like AVL and Red-Black trees? (Remembering) (Balanced Trees: AVL and Red-Black Trees)
Option A: They are more complex to implement
Option B: They are less efficient in terms of time complexity
Option C: They ensure the height of the tree remains small
Option D: They are only used for small datasets
Correct Answer: C) They ensure the height of the tree remains small

Question: What is the difference between AVL trees and Red-Black trees? (Theoretical) (Balanced Trees: AVL and Red-Black Trees)
Option A: AVL trees are balanced, while Red-Black trees are not
Option B: AVL trees use rotations, while Red-Black trees use coloring
Option C: AVL trees are used for small datasets, while Red-Black trees are used for large datasets
Option D: AVL trees are less efficient than Red-Black trees
Correct Answer: B) AVL trees use rotations, while Red-Black trees use coloring

Option A: Game development

Option C: Maintaining a list of predefined settings or configuration values
Option D: All of the above
Correct Answer: D) All of the above

Option A: They use less memory than doubly linked lists
Option B: They use more memory than doubly linked lists
Option C: They are only used for large datasets
Option D: They are not suitable for dynamic data
Correct Answer: A) They use less memory than doubly linked lists

Option B: They are more complex than singly linked lists

Question: What is the primary property of a Max-Heap? (Theoretical) (Max-Heap Characteristics)
Option A: The value of each node is less than or equal to its children
Option B: The value of each node is greater than or equal to its children
Option C: The value of each node is equal to its children
Option D: The value of each node is not related to its children
Correct Answer: B) The value of each node is greater than or equal to its children

Question: What is the advantage of balanced trees in terms of time complexity? (Logical Reasoning) (Balanced Trees: AVL and Red-Black Trees)

Correct Answer: B) They are more efficient in terms of time complexity

Question: What is the advantage of balanced trees in terms of height? (Theoretical) (Balanced Trees: AVL and Red-Black Trees)
